Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery kernos, together with one leg, part of double-reeded handle and two vessel holders; very worn white slip; interior of vessel holders glazed black; interior of kernos, reserved; exterior of vessel holders reserved with black vertical lines on either side; bands around exterior of body and on leg.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.154.a and belongs to the same vase as 1888,0601.154.d.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 250, no. 362)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 84, no. 59, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2187) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
